data.name: richTextBox1.Text
data.value:
Spreadsheet Help Authors: Carina Imburgia and Aaron Carlisle
Table of Contents:
a. Introduction b. Basic spreadsheet functionality c. Mathematical functionality d. Open/Save e. Undo f. Verison
a. Introduction
This app provides a basic spreadsheet to the user with the ability to add and update data within cells, perform mathamatical operations with built-in formula evaluation, and save data for later use. Read/write functionality is also included. Contents of cells will be error checked and updated accordingly along with any dependent cells.
b. Basic spreadsheet functionality
Click on or toggle through cells using the arrow keys. To update a cell's contents, simply edit the "contents" text bar (pre-selected) and when finished press enter. Cell name and value are pre-populated in the upper part of the spreadsheet. Error checking is incoperated in the spreadsheet and the user will be notified of any invaid updates.
c. Mathematical functionality
Cells may be updated with formulas. All formulas must obide by valid order of operations and may contain and real number or scientific notation (i.e 5E-3). Formulas may refernce other formulas via use of variables. A valid variable must directly or indirectly refernece a cell with a number as its contents. For example, a valid vaiable must contain one case insensitive letter followed by one number 1-99. To obtain an evaluated cell value, formulas must be prefaced with "=", e.g =A1+5. Evaluation will then happen upon pressing enter. Value will be displayed above and also in the cell itself. Divide by zero and undefined varibale operations are not supported and will result in a spreadsheet error.
d.Open/Save
File save and open functionality is supported through the menu bar. Load saved work or save updated work by pressing the corresponding drop downs in the file menu. File type SPRD is default, however most txt formats are supported. Error checking and overwrite notifications will ensure no unintential data loss.
e. Undo
This functionality is usable once you add data to the spreadsheet, by pressing the Undo button in the top right. You are able to revert all the way back to the first change made to the spreadsheet.
f. Visualizer
This is a fun relaxing bonus feature to try out. To begin the program, simply select "Visualize" from the menu bar. Click on or arrow-key through any cell you want to fill in the background with a randomly generated color. In that same menu, click on clear to revert back to a plain spreadsheet. Data will not be lost with this feature.
g. Version 1.0 10/21/2018
